website_summaries.verdict: The Canon imageFormula DR-C225 document scanner delivers fast scans with excellent text-recognition accuracy, and it comes with a highly useful collection of top-tier application programs.
pros: Fast text recognition for scanning to searchable PDF format
Comes with several top-tier application programs
cons: Business card recognition is a little weak

website_summaries.verdict: The Canon imageFormula DR-C225W document scanner can connect by Wi-Fi for network scanning and also lets you connect directly from mobile devices.
pros: Fast text recognition for scanning to searchable PDF format
cons: Although business-card recognition is good enough to be useful, it's well short of excellent

customer_reviews.title: Works well and saves a lot of time over using a flatbed scanner
customer_reviews.text: The scanner came early, which was good for me. It works well but I get jams if I try to scan a sheet with paper of photos stuck on it. I was also looking for a scanner that did good OCR, but the Canon CaptureonTouch V4's OCR results were poor. The product was supposed to come with a different scanning software , better for OCR, but I couldn't find this in the box. It was only after contacting the seller, who was very helpful, that I got a link to a webpage where this could be downloaded.
customer_reviews.author: Cruckster

customer_reviews.title: Could be so much better but let down by poor drivers / s/w
customer_reviews.text: Could be so much better, but the connectivity lets it down. It only works on my MacBook from a cold restart. If someone else comes a long to scan it drops the connection to my MacBook then says cannot load the driver. Solution - restart my MacBook. Very disappointed after spending so much money on a scanner. If I had my time again I'd go Doxie! Cheaper and easier to use. Don't be lulled into thinking higher cost = better quality. p.s. Cannot even connect wirelessly on my Win10 machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IMPOSSIBLE SET-UP
customer_reviews.text: You just get tired of setting this thing up EVERY TIME you wanted to use it. You get it set up as wi-fi but it refuses to retain that setting and you have to do it ALL OVER AGAIN. What idiot dreamt this up. Here's a thought - I'm buying this to SAVE TIME not use up all my spare time. If I can find the box it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Mcewen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: This scanner doesn't work due to poor USB connection and driver failure. I have tried this under Windows 7 and IOS on a Mac. It worked for a short while on the Mac, but suddenly refuses to operate and complains of not finding the driver software. Under Windows it can't make a connection between computer and scanner. Very disappointing. I have spent a lot of time trying to reinstall but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: m dokter

customer_reviews.title: Stunning speed double-sided scans
customer_reviews.text: Stunning speed and double sided at the same time. Using it to file all incoming mail correspondence on my PC. Easy enough to connect to wifi although no paper manual - all online. Have had a couple of paper feed jams. Bundled software more tricky to fathom in order to get the output where you want it on your PC. Fathomed it out in the end but took a while. The speed and scan quality does it for me though - very impressive
customer_reviews.author: Mr N

customer_reviews.title: Good Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Very good scanner, manages to digest most of the paper I need to put through it, only really thick items seem to stump it. Easy and convenient to use. I found setting up the WiFi a bit problematic so use it on a USB into a PC. Maybe others will have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Astillsmallvoice

customer_reviews.title: amazon where brilliant as usual though and have me refund
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work:(kept telling me there was no paper in feeder even though there was.amazon where brilliant as usual though and have me refund.disappointed as I'd high hopes for device.
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous squeaking sound after 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 1 day and scanned well. Loved the capability of the equipment, HOWEVER, after 1 day of functioning well it is making a horrendous squeaking sound which is so loud that it is difficult to be in the same room as the scanner when the pages are being scanned. Unforgivable.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav Khungar

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Really improved my workflow, scans bundles of document really easily, software is intuitive. Takes up very little space on my desk a really good buy
customer_reviews.author: Pete B

customer_reviews.title: Very bad service.
customer_reviews.text: The scanner didn't recognise USP to computer . our IT engineer couldn't rectify the problem . Decided to send it back to amazon but passed sending back day. Now I have a scanner, which doesn't work that can't use . Thank you Amazon. Very bad service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless as a wifi printer
customer_reviews.text: Wifi doesn't work on OSX. 10.12 and for some reason it worked once. Never again. Amazon won't take a return either? It's only been a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: yeled

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast and excellent service - product exactly as described - thank you
customer_reviews.author: Mennieb

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare to set up
customer_reviews.text: Absolute nightmare to get it set up, especially the wireless (on the W version). I will come back and update this review if I ever get this scanner to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic- though is hard to get the wireless connection to work
customer_reviews.author: P J.

customer_reviews.title: very useful, tidy up of paperwork.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant product... scans really quickly turning documents into searchable pdfs - does double sides scanning. Only tip - install the extra software rather than the typical installation. Not sure how useful it really is but worth having. Tiny desk foot print.. don't rate the business card scanner much though..
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Virtually impossible to set up on a home wireless network
customer_reviews.author: freetail

customer_reviews.title: ++ Duplex (two-sided) scanning with good wifi connectivity ++
customer_reviews.text: The Canon imageFormula DR-C225W document scanner can connect by Wi-Fi for network scanning and also lets you connect directly from mobile devices, however you will want to compare to this version to get the most for your money found here:  PROS: + Duplex (two-sided) scanning. + Wi-Fi and Wi-Fi Direct. + Fast text recognition for scanning to searchable PDF format. + Excellent text-recognition accuracy. CONS: - Although business-card recognition is good enough to be useful, it's well short of excellent.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I did not order mine from Amazon as it was cheaper elsewhere. However having just installed it on 16/09/2015, I am blown away by the performance and quality. I came from an HP all in one laser printer with scanner that cost me £550 and this scanner out performs it in every way. Speed, Quality and canon build quality, what more can I ask for? Shaun
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Terrible waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on the wireless version. Save your time and money. In short, it just doesn't work with the CaptureOnTouch software. Buy the much cheaper cabled version. Always bought Canon but after this experience - never again!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

product_meta.title: CNMDRC225 - Canon imageFORMULA DR-C225 Sheetfed Scanner - 600 dpi Optical
